page.title: 03HISTORIC AND SCENIC INTEREST
page.content: Whilst the majority of housing in Newton is post-war there is considerable historic and scenic interest in West Kirby and Caldy. St.Bridgets Parish Church in West Kirby has featured as a place of Christian worship for nearly one thousand years and West Kirby is one of the oldest settlements on the Wirral. The old village of West Kirby,not far from the church is also of interest and in recent years it has undergone restoration and also includes the Ring O Bells,an eighteenth century coaching inn. The older part of Caldy village is also built of red sandstone and is one of the most picturesque parts of the area.Although there has been a lot of building the character of the village has been maintained.
